eu.excitement.entailment.core.representation.parsetree

Class PartOfSpeech

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.excitement.entailment.core.representation.parsetree.PartOfSpeech
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public abstract class PartOfSpeech
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

    [DELETEME_LATER This code has been imported from BIUTEE 2.4.1, with minor modifications: 1) the field "CanonicalPosTag" is a different type. 2) The exception "UnsupportedPosTagString" is a different type.]

    Represents part-of-speech tag. The purpose of this class is to wrap the part-of-speech tag that is given by an external resource (e.g. parser or pos-tagger).

    THIS CLASS IS IMMUTABLE. SUBCLASSES SHOULD BE IMMUTABLE AS WELL!

    This class is abstract, and each sub-class should specify which tags are supported, and how each tag is mapped to a canonical part-of-speech tag: CanonicalPosTag. For those purposes, each subclass should override the methods validatePosTagString(String) and setCanonicalPosTag().

    Improtant note for all implementations: The validation, from the user's point of view is optional. I.e. the user may write a code like: 

     MyPartOfSpeech pos = null;
 try
 {
    MyPartOfSpeech pos = new MyPartOfSpeech("blabla");
 }
 catch(UnsupportedPosTagStringException e)
 {
    // do nothing
 }
 ...
 // continue code here, using pos, and assuming pos is not null.
    Since:
    Author:
    Asher Stern (Imported from BIUTEE 2.4.1)
    See Also:

    • Constructor Detail

      • PartOfSpeech

        public PartOfSpeech(java.lang.String posTagString)
             throws UnsupportedPosTagStringException
        Gets a string that represents the part of speech, and constructs a PartOfSpeech object based on that string.

        The flow is as follows:

        • The given string is validated. I.e. the given string is tested whether it is one of the expected strings for the specific PartOfSpeech subclass.
        • Then, it is set as the string representation of this PartOfSpeech object. It can be later retrieved by the method getStringRepresentation()
        • Then, a canonical-part-of-speech, i.e. one of the predefined part-of-speech values in CanonicalPosTag is chosen, based on the given string. That canonical value can be retrieved later by the method getCanonicalPosTag()
        Parameters:
        posTagString -
        Throws:
        UnsupportedPosTagStringException

    • Method Detail

      • getCanonicalPosTag

        public CanonicalPosTag getCanonicalPosTag()
        Returns a canonical representation of this part-of-speech.
        Returns:

      • getStringRepresentation

        public java.lang.String getStringRepresentation()
        Returns the string representation of this part-of-speech. This string is merely the string that was given by the constructor of this part-of-speech. Usually, the string is given by an external resource (e.g. a parser, of pos-tagger), and the PartOfSpeech object wraps it.
        Returns:

      • createNewPartOfSpeech

        public abstract PartOfSpeech createNewPartOfSpeech(java.lang.String posTagString)
                                            throws UnsupportedPosTagStringException
        Creates a new PartOfSpeech object, that has the same type of the callee. For example: if PennPartOfSpeech.newPartOfSpeech() is called, then a new PennPartOfSpeech will be created and returned.
        Parameters:
        posTagString -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        UnsupportedPosTagStringException
